content:
DataServiceQuery<TElement> Class

In this Article

Represents a single query request to a data service.

Syntax

Declaration

public class DataServiceQuery<TElement> : System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TElement>, System.Linq.IQueryable<TElement>

Type Parameters

TElement

Type of results returned by the query.

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DataServiceRequest
  • System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery
  • DataServiceQuery<TElement>

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

No public constructors are defined on this class. Object instances are created by using <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A> on the DataServiceContext class.

Properties summary

ElementType

Returns the type of the object used in the template to create the stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 instance.
Expression

Represents an expression containing the query to the data service.
Provider

Represents the query provider instance.
RequestUri

Get the URI for the query.

Methods summary

AddQueryOption(String,Object)

Creates a new stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 with the query option set in the URI generated by the returned query.
BeginExecute(AsyncCallback,Object)

Starts an asynchronous network operation that executes the query represented by this object instance.
EndExecute(IAsyncResult)

Ends an asynchronous query request to a data service.
Execute()

Executes the query and returns the results as a collection that implements IEnumerable.
Expand(String)

Creates a new stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 with the expand option set in the URI generated by the returned query.
GetEnumerator()

Executes the query and returns the results as a collection.
IncludeTotalCount()

Requests that the count of all entities in the entity set be returned inline with the query results.
ToString()

Represents the URI of the query to the data service.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Executes the query and returns the results as a collection.

Properties

  • ElementType

    Returns the type of the object used in the template to create the stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 instance.

    public override Type ElementType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      Returns Type representing the type used in the template when the query is created.

    Remarks

    Gets the type represented by T in the generic methods: <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A>.

  • Expression

    Represents an expression containing the query to the data service.

    public override System.Linq.Expressions.Expression Expression { get; }

    Property Value

    • Expression

      A Expression object representing the query.

  • Provider

    Represents the query provider instance.

    public override System.Linq.IQueryProvider Provider { get; }

    Property Value

    • IQueryProvider

      A IQueryProvider representing the data source provider.

  • RequestUri

    Get the URI for the query.

    public override Uri RequestUri { get; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      The URI of the request.

Methods

  • AddQueryOption(String,Object)

    Creates a new stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 with the query option set in the URI generated by the returned query.

    public System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery<TElement> AddQueryOption (string name, object value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The string value that contains the name of the query string option to add.

    • value
      Object

      The object that contains the value of the query string option.

    Returns

    • DataServiceQuery

      A new query that includes the requested query option appended to the URI of the supplied query

    Remarks

    The query options are added to the resultant URI using ?name=value&name2=value2â€¦ syntax where the name maps directly to the name parameter and the value is obtained by calling ToString on the value parameter. The name starts with $.

    Non-WCF Data Services syntax does not start with $. Non-WCF Data Services query options can be added using this method. It is legal to add the same query option twice if the option is not an WCF Data Services query option. If a query option is added that is already present in the underlying URI, an exception is thrown.

    Example

    The following example shows a DataServiceQuery<TElement> that is used with sequential AddQueryOption method calls to only return orders with a freight cost of more than $30 and to order the results by the ship date in descending order. 

    ' Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
Dim context = New NorthwindEntities(svcUri)

' Define a query for orders with a Freight value greater than 30
' and that is ordered by the ship date, descending.
Dim selectedOrders As DataServiceQuery(Of Order) = context.Orders _
.AddQueryOption("$filter", "Freight gt 30") _
.AddQueryOption("$orderby", "OrderID desc")

Try
    ' Enumerate over the results of the query.
    For Each order As Order In selectedOrders
        Console.WriteLine("Order ID: {0} - Ship Date: {1} - Freight: {2}", _
                order.OrderID, order.ShippedDate, order.Freight)
    Next
Catch ex As DataServiceQueryException
    Throw New ApplicationException( _
            "An error occurred during query execution.", ex)
End Try

    // Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
NorthwindEntities context = new NorthwindEntities(svcUri);

// Define a query for orders with a Freight value greater than 30
// and that is ordered by the ship date, descending.
DataServiceQuery<Order> selectedOrders = context.Orders
    .AddQueryOption("$filter", "Freight gt 30")
    .AddQueryOption("$orderby", "OrderID desc");

try
{
    // Enumerate over the results of the query.
    foreach (Order order in selectedOrders)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Order ID: {0} - Ship Date: {1} - Freight: {2}", 
            order.OrderID, order.ShippedDate, order.Freight);
    }
}
catch (DataServiceQueryException ex)
{
    throw new ApplicationException(
        "An error occurred during query execution.", ex);
}

    The following example shows how to compose a LINQ query that is equivalent to the previous query that used AddQueryOption. 

    ' Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
Dim context = New NorthwindEntities(svcUri)

' Define a query for orders with a Freight value greater than 30
' and that is ordered by the ship date, descending.
Dim selectedOrders = From o In context.Orders _
        Where (o.Freight > 30) _
        Order By o.ShippedDate Descending _
        Select o

Try
    ' Enumerate over the results of the query.
    For Each order As Order In selectedOrders
        Console.WriteLine("Order ID: {0} - Ship Date: {1} - Freight: {2}", _
                order.OrderID, order.ShippedDate, order.Freight)
    Next
Catch ex As DataServiceQueryException
    Throw New ApplicationException( _
            "An error occurred during query execution.", ex)
End Try

    // Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
NorthwindEntities context = new NorthwindEntities(svcUri);

// Define a query for orders with a Freight value greater than 30
// and that is ordered by the ship date, descending.
var selectedOrders = from o in context.Orders
                     where o.Freight > 30
                     orderby o.ShippedDate descending 
                     select o;

try
{
    // Enumerate over the results of the query.
    foreach (Order order in selectedOrders)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Order ID: {0} - Ship Date: {1} - Freight: {2}",
            order.OrderID, order.ShippedDate, order.Freight);
    }
}
catch (DataServiceQueryException ex)
{
    throw new ApplicationException(
        "An error occurred during query execution.", ex);
}
  • BeginExecute(AsyncCallback,Object)

    Starts an asynchronous network operation that executes the query represented by this object instance.

    public IAsyncResult BeginExecute (AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The delegate to invoke when the operation completes.

    • state
      Object

      User defined object used to transfer state between the start of the operation and the callback defined by callback.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult that represents the status of the asynchronous operation.

  • EndExecute(IAsyncResult)

    Ends an asynchronous query request to a data service.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TElement> EndExecute (IAsyncResult asyncResult);

    Parameters

    • asyncResult
      IAsyncResult

      The pending asynchronous query request.

    Returns

    • IEnumerable<TElement>

      Returns an stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1 that contains the results of the query operation.

    Exceptions

    • DataServiceQueryException

      When the data service returns an HTTP 404: Resource Not Found error.

  • Execute()

    Executes the query and returns the results as a collection that implements IEnumerable.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TElement> Execute ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerable<TElement>

      An stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1 in which T represents the type of the query results.

    Exceptions

    • DataServiceQueryException

      When the data service returns an HTTP 404: Resource Not Found error.

    Remarks

    When iterating over the returned collection, if an object is encountered in the input stream that cannot be deserialized to an instance of T then a NotSupportedException is thrown.

  • Expand(String)

    Creates a new stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 with the expand option set in the URI generated by the returned query.

    public System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery<TElement> Expand (string path);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      A string value that contains the requesting URI.

    Returns

    • DataServiceQuery

      A new query that includes the requested $expand query option appended to the URI of the supplied query.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Executes the query and returns the results as a collection.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<TElement> GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator<TElement>

      A typed enumerator over the results in which TEntity represents the type of the query results.

    Remarks

    When the GetEnumerator method is called, the DataServiceQuery<TElement> is executed against the service.

  • IncludeTotalCount()

    Requests that the count of all entities in the entity set be returned inline with the query results.

    public System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery<TElement> IncludeTotalCount ();

    Returns

    • DataServiceQuery

      A new stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 object that has the inline count option set.

    Remarks

    Calling the IncludeTotalCount method is equivalent to including the $inlinecount query option in the query URI.

    Example

    This example executes a query after it calls the IncludeTotalCount method. The TotalCount property is used to determine number of entities returned by the query. 

    ' Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
Dim context = New NorthwindEntities(svcUri)

' Define a new query for Customers that includes the total count.
Dim query As DataServiceQuery(Of Customer) = _
context.Customers.IncludeTotalCount()

Try
    ' Execute the query for all customers and get the response object.
    Dim response As QueryOperationResponse(Of Customer) = _
        CType(query.Execute(), QueryOperationResponse(Of Customer))

    ' Retrieve the total count from the response.
    Console.WriteLine("There are a total of {0} customers.", response.TotalCount)

    ' Enumerate the customers in the response.
    For Each customer As Customer In response
        Console.WriteLine(vbTab & "Customer Name: {0}", customer.CompanyName)
    Next
Catch ex As DataServiceQueryException
    Throw New ApplicationException( _
            "An error occurred during query execution.", ex)
End Try

    // Create the DataServiceContext using the service URI.
NorthwindEntities context = new NorthwindEntities(svcUri);

// Define a new query for Customers that includes the total count.
DataServiceQuery<Customer> query = context.Customers.IncludeTotalCount();

try
{    
    // Execute the query for all customers and get the response object.
    QueryOperationResponse<Customer> response = 
        query.Execute() as QueryOperationResponse<Customer>;

    // Retrieve the total count from the response.
    Console.WriteLine("There are a total of {0} customers.", response.TotalCount);

    // Enumerate the customers in the response.
    foreach (Customer customer in response)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("    Customer Name: {0}", customer.CompanyName);
    }
}
catch (DataServiceQueryException ex)
{
    throw new ApplicationException(
        "An error occurred during query execution.", ex);
}
  • ToString()

    Represents the URI of the query to the data service.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A URI as string that represents the query to the data service for this stem.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery`1 instance.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    Executes the query and returns the results as a collection.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An enumerator over the query results.

    Remarks

    When the IEnumerable.GetEnumerator method is called, the DataServiceQuery<TElement> is executed against the service.

    GetEnumerator returns an enumerable the first time it is called. On successive calls it returns null.
